title: Perspectives on Identity and Culture; Introduction to American Indian Cultures of the U.S.
description: Also offered as ANTH468F and RELS319N. Credit granted for AMST328N, ANTH468F or RELS319N. This course surveys the cultures and the historical and contemporary struggles of indigenous peoples of the United States, with a focus on understanding and contrasting the sacred worldviews of indigenous peoples of the U.S. and beyond with the worldviews of both western science and Christianity. It challenges participants to learn more about these worldviews--and about their own worldviews and identities-- through a life-history-based, ethnographic research approach as well as through course readings and class activities and discussions
